data.title: Trevor Stacy - Football
data.meta_description: Trevor Stacy (78) Offensive Line  - At Charlotte: Made 49ers debut Sept. 10, 2016 vs. Elon ... signed with the 49ers on Feb. 4, 2015 as part of the program’s fourth
data.text:
At Charlotte: Made 49ers debut Sept. 10, 2016 vs. Elon ... signed with the 49ers on Feb. 4, 2015 as part of the program’s fourth signee class. 2016: Played in two games on the offensive line ... saw action at #19 Kansas State, 9/9 and at WKU, 10/14. 2016: Played in one game as a red-shirt freshman ... lone appearance came in home opening win vs. Elon. 2015: Red-shirt season.

At Spring Valley H.S.: A three-time first-team Class AAA all-state selection ... 2014 Hart Award Winner as the West Virginia Sports Writers Association Top Lineman for head coach Brad Dingess ... Named the Herald-Dispatch Tri-State Player of the Year and to the all-Tri-State team ... four-year starter holds record for most starts in school history ... Led Timberwolves to a 7-4 mark and a spot in the AAA playoffs as a senior ... Timberwolves reached state playoffs in each of his four years including trip to state quarterfinals in sophomore year (8-4) ... a three-time first team all-Area and first-team all-Mountain State Athletic Conference choice ... a three-star recruit by ESPN.com and received two stars from Rivals.com and 247 Sports ... Herald Dispatch writer Tim Stephens said of the standout offensive lineman that he “had more pancakes than IHOP” ... former Charlotte 49ers offensive line coach Phil Ratliff coached at Spring Valley High before moving into the college ranks.
